avdta.network.node

Class TBR

  • java.lang.Object
    • avdta.network.node.IntersectionControl
      • avdta.network.node.TBR
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    IPTBR, PriorityTBR

    public abstract class TBR
extends IntersectionControl
    This is an abstract representation of reservation-based intersection control. TBR stands for tile-based reservation. Vehicle movement is left to subclasses, but the work of generating ConflictRegions is taken care of.

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initializes this TBR after data has been read. This method creates the ConflictRegions that each turning movement passes through.
        Specified by:
        initialize in class IntersectionControl
        See Also:
        ConflictFactory

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets this TBR to restart simulation. This resets all ConflictRegions.
        Specified by:
        reset in class IntersectionControl

      • getConflicts

        public java.util.Set<ConflictRegion> getConflicts(Vehicle v)
        Returns the Set of ConflictRegions that the specified Vehicle must pass through. This relies on Vehicle.getPrevLink() being an incoming Link, and Vehicle.getNextLink() being an outgoing Link.
        Parameters:
        v - the Vehicle wanting to move
        Returns:
        the Set of ConflictRegions that the specified Vehicle must pass through

      • getConflicts

        public java.util.Set<ConflictRegion> getConflicts()
        Returns a set containing all ConflictRegions associated with this intersection.
        Returns:
        a set containing all ConflictRegions

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove(Link i,
                       Link j,
                       DriverType driver)
        Returns whether the specified turning movement is valid. A turning movement is valid if there is a set of associated ConflictRegions. U-turns are not valid, but all other turns are. The DriverType is not checked here. It is checked in the Link class.
        Specified by:
        canMove in class IntersectionControl
        Parameters:
        i - the incoming Link
        j - the outgoing Link
        driver - the DriverType
        Returns:
        whether the specified turning movement is valid

      • updateCRCapacity

        public void updateCRCapacity()
        Updates the ConflictRegion capacities in response to changing numbers of lanes. This is relevant to dynamic lane reversal and dynamic transit lanes.

      • hasAvailableCapacity

        public boolean hasAvailableCapacity(Link i,
                                    Link j,
                                    double flow)
        Checks whether there is available capacity to make the specified turning movement with the specified required flow.
        Parameters:
        i - the incoming Link
        j - the outgoing Link
        flow - equivalent flow of the vehicle. This may be reduced for autonomous vehicles due to lower following headways.
        Returns:
        if there is sufficient capacity to make the specified turn

      • getType

        public abstract int getType()
        Returns the type code representing this intersection control.
        Specified by:
        getType in class IntersectionControl
        Returns:
        depends on the subclass
